item.title: 独家报道文件指控：竞争对手首席执行官向华尔街散布对新日铁交易前景的疑虑
item.description: 就在新日铁公司面临拜登政府对其 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司这一注定失败的出价的怀疑时，它还面临着来自一个不可能的来源的阻力：该公司竞争对手的首席执行官一再向投资者对该交易的前景表示怀疑。【原文：Even as Nippon Steel faced skepticism of its doomed $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel from the Biden administration, it was also contending with headwinds from an unlikely source: the CEO of a rival bidder for the firm who repeatedly cast doubt on the deal's prospects to investors.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，中国黑客入侵美国电信公司的数量超出此前已知范围
item.description: 华尔街日报》周六晚间援引知情人士的话报道称，中国黑客入侵的美国电信公司比之前已知的还要多，其中包括 Charter Communications、Consolidated Communications (CCII.UL) 和 Windstream。【原文：A Chinese hack compromised even more U.S. telecoms than previously known, including Charter Communications , Consolidated Communications (CCII.UL) and Windstream, the Wall Street Journal reported late on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司将于春季在航班上使用马斯克的 "星链 "技术
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周日表示，预计将于今年 2 月开始测试埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的星链（Starlink）机上互联网服务，并将于今年春季首次在巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）E-175 飞机运营的商业航班上提供这种连接。【原文：United Airlines said on Sunday it expects to begin testing Elon Musk's Starlink in February for in-flight internet services, and to first offer the connectivity on a commercial flight operated by Embraer E-175 aircraft this spring.】

item.title: 富士康第四季度营收增长 15.2
item.description: 全球最大的合约电子制造商、苹果公司最大的 iPhone 组装商台湾富士康周日发布报告称，其第四季度收入增长 15.2%，创下该季度历史新高。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn , the world's largest contract electronics maker and Apple's biggest iPhone assembler, reported on Sunday that its fourth-quarter revenue jumped 15.2%, reaching a record high for the quarter.】

item.title: 中国寻求加强西部地区港口和航空枢纽建设
item.description: 中国周日表示，将推出 15 项措施，通过建设港口和航空枢纽等物流基础设施来促进西部省份的发展。【原文：China said on Sunday it would launch 15 measures to bolster the development of its western provinces with the construction of logistical infrastructure such as ports and aviation hubs.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒和戴利称抑制通胀的工作尚未完成
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）周六表示，美国经济在2024年结束时形势良好，通胀率从峰值回落，劳动力市场接近充分就业，但美国央行在抑制通胀方面的工作尚未完成。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler on Saturday said the U.S. economy ended 2024 in a good place, with inflation down from its peak and the labor market near full employment, but the U.S. central bank's job on taming inflation is not yet done.】

item.title: 机构援引俄罗斯工业部消息，2024 年俄罗斯新车销量将增长 47
item.description: 据俄罗斯通讯社周六援引工业和贸易部数据报道，2024 年俄罗斯新乘用车销量同比增长 47%，达到 155 万辆。【原文：Sales of new passenger cars in Russia increased by 47% year on year to 1.55 million units in 2024, Russian news agencies reported on Saturday, citing industry and trade ministry data.】

item.title: 司法部敦促最高法院驳回特朗普推迟 TikTok 禁令的请求
item.description: 美国司法部周五晚些时候请求最高法院驳回当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关于推迟实施一项法律的请求，该法律将在 1 月 19 日前禁止流行社交媒体应用 TikTok 或强制其出售。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice asked the Supreme Court late on Friday to reject President-elect Donald Trump's request to delay implementation of a law that would ban popular social media app TikTok or force its sale by Jan. 19.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒称数据将推动美联储在不确定性中做出政策选择
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）周五表示，美国央行对2025年的经济表现并不确定，将让即将公布的经济数据来推动货币政策的走向。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said on Friday the U.S. central bank is uncertain about what the economy will deliver in 2025 and will let upcoming economic data drive the course of monetary policy.】

item.title: 美国冬季风暴可能导致停电，切断天然气供应
item.description: 据能源分析师和可靠性协调员称，美国各地的冰冻天气和暴风雪可能会在未来一周内造成大规模停电，并使天然气需求达到冬季最高水平。【原文：Freezing weather and snow storms across the U.S. could cause massive power outages over the next week and boost natural gas demand to its highest levels of the winter, according to energy analysts and reliability coordinators.】

item.title: 犹他州诉讼称，TikTok 知道其直播剥削儿童
item.description: 根据犹他州最新公布的诉讼材料，TikTok 早就知道其视频直播鼓励性行为并剥削儿童，但却视而不见，因为它从中 "获利颇丰"。【原文：TikTok has long known its video livestreams encourage sexual conduct and exploit children yet turned a blind eye because it "profited significantly" from them, according to newly unsealed material in a lawsuit by the state of Utah.】

item.title: 房利美和房地美股价在联邦机构透露私有化路径后大涨
item.description: 房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）是自 2008 年以来受美国政府控制的抵押贷款巨头，在联邦机构公布了 "有序 "解除对它们的监管的框架后，这两家公司的股价周五飙升至多年来的新高。【原文：Shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac , the mortgage giants under U.S. government control since 2008, surged to multi-year highs on Friday after federal agencies revealed a framework for their "orderly" release from conservatorship.】

item.title: 高盛任命亚历克斯-戈尔滕为首席风险官
item.description: 美国高盛银行周五任命亚历克斯-戈尔滕（Alex Golten）为新任首席风险官。【原文：U.S. bank Goldman Sachs on Friday named Alex Golten as its new chief risk officer.】

item.title: 微软计划在 2025 财年斥资 800 亿美元建设人工智能数据中心
item.description: 微软公司周五在一篇博文中表示，该公司计划在2025财年斥资约800亿美元建设数据中心，用于训练人工智能（AI）模型和部署AI及基于云的应用。【原文：Microsoft is planning to spend about $80 billion in fiscal 2025 to build data centers to train artificial intelligence (AI) models and deploy AI and cloud-based applications, the company said in a blog post on Friday.】

item.title: 波音公司和司法部告诉美国法官，他们尚未就修改后的认罪协议达成协议
item.description: 美国司法部和波音公司周五向法庭表示，他们尚未就修改后的认罪协议达成一致，此前美国法官于 12 月驳回了该协议，指责其中的多元化和包容性条款。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department and Boeing told a court on Friday they have not reached agreement on a revised plea deal after a U.S. judge in December rejected the deal, faulting a diversity and inclusion provision.】

item.title: PayPal 被指控在资助项目中对亚裔美国人存在种族偏见
item.description: 一名亚裔女商人起诉 PayPal，指控这家数字支付公司在一项价值 5.35 亿美元的投资计划中将部分投资限制给黑人和拉美裔申请人，造成她数百万美元的损失，从而产生了种族偏见。【原文：PayPal has been sued by an Asian American businesswoman who accused the digital payments company of racial bias for restricting part of a $535 million investment program to Black and Hispanic applicants, costing her millions of dollars.】

item.title: SpaceX 的 "星际飞船 "将在下一次测试中部署模拟卫星
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）周五表示，即将进行的 "星际飞船"（Starship）试飞将包括火箭首次尝试在太空部署有效载荷，释放十颗星链（Starlink）卫星模型，这是 "星际飞船 "在卫星发射市场潜力的一次重要展示。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX on Friday said its upcoming Starship test flight will include the rocket's first attempt to deploy payloads in space by releasing ten model Starlink satellites, a key demonstration for Starship's potential in the satellite launch market.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美国就业报告构成 2025 年股市首次重大考验
item.description: 下周股市将面临今年的首次重大考验，投资者寄希望于美国就业报告显示经济稳定但不过热，从而支撑对 2025 年股市上涨的预期。【原文：The stock market faces its first major test of the year in the coming week, with investors counting on the U.S. jobs report to show a stable but not overheated economy that underpins expectations for equity gains in 2025.】

item.title: 文件显示，美国监管机构对加密货币持谨慎态度，但并未要求银行封锁该行业
item.description: 据周五公布的文件显示，美国最高银行监管机构要求多家贷款机构在 2022 年和 2023 年暂停直接涉足加密货币领域，但并未指示它们停止向加密货币公司提供银行服务。【原文：A top U.S. bank regulator told multiple lenders to pause dabbling directly in crypto in 2022 and 2023, but did not direct them to stop providing banking services to crypto companies, according to documents released on Friday.】

item.title: 巴西与航空公司达成协议解决纳税义务问题
item.description: 巴西政府周五表示，已与该国最大的两家航空公司 Gol 和 Azul 达成协议，解决部分未决税款，总额达 75 亿雷亚尔（约合 12.2 亿美元）。【原文：Brazil's government said on Friday it has reached deals with two of the country's largest airlines, Gol and Azul , to settle some pending tax obligations totaling 7.5 billion reais ($1.22 billion).】

item.title: 2024 年福特在美国的销量增长 4.2
item.description: 福特汽车公司周五公布，受汽油车和混合动力车需求增加的推动，其 2024 年的美国销量增长了 4.2%。【原文：Ford Motor reported a 4.2% rise in its 2024 U.S. sales on Friday, driven by higher demand for gasoline and hybrid vehicles.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴金未来一年前景乐观，存在上行风险
item.description: 里奇蒙德联储主席托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周五表示，尽管贸易和即将上任的特朗普政府可能推行的其他政策的影响存在不确定性，但2025年美国经济前景乐观，增长上行风险大于下行风险。【原文：The outlook for the U.S. economy in 2025 is positive with more upside than downside risk to growth despite uncertainty about the impact of trade and other policies that may be pursued by the incoming Trump administration, Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin said on Friday.】

item.title: 丰田 2024 年美国销量增长 3.7
item.description: 丰田汽车北美分公司周五公布，受益于混合动力汽车需求的增长，美国汽车年销量增长了 3.7%。【原文：Toyota Motor North America reported a 3.7% rise in annual U.S. auto sales on Friday, benefiting from higher demand for its hybrid vehicles.】

item.title: 通用汽车 2024 年美国销量增长 4.3
item.description: 通用汽车公司周五公布，受皮卡和 SUV 需求增加的支撑，美国汽车年销量增长 4.3%。【原文：General Motors Co reported a 4.3% rise in annual U.S. auto sales on Friday, supported by higher demand for its pickup trucks and SUVs.】

item.title: 富国银行将花旗评为 "最佳选择"，并预测其股价将在三年内翻番
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）分析师周五在一份客户报告中写道，随着这家华尔街贷款公司的利润激增，花旗集团的股票价值可能在未来三年翻一番，并被该券商评为大市值银行业的最佳选择。【原文：Citigroup's stock could double in value over the next three years as the Wall Street lender's profits surge, Wells Fargo analysts wrote in a client note on Friday, naming it the brokerage's top pick in the large-cap banking sector.】

item.title: 美国对中国诚信科技公司实施网络安全制裁
item.description: 美国财政部网站上的一则公告显示，美国周五对从事计算机编程的中国公司诚信科技集团（Integrity Technology Group）实施了新的网络安全制裁。【原文：The United States on Friday issued fresh cybersecurity sanctions against Integrity Technology Group, a Chinese company involved in computer programming, a posting on the Treasury Department website showed.】

item.title: 美国因航班长期延误对捷蓝航空公司罚款 200 万美元
item.description: 美国运输部对捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）处以 200 万美元的罚款，原因是该公司在国内航线上运营了 4 个长期延误的航班，这是该部门首次因禁止的航班调度做法对航空公司处以此类罚款。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department has imposed a $2 million penalty on JetBlue Airways for operating four chronically delayed flights on domestic routes - the first time it has imposed such a fine on an airline for the prohibited scheduling practice.】

item.title: 美国 12 月制造业采购经理人指数升至九个月高点
item.description: 12 月份，美国制造业接近复苏，生产反弹，新订单进一步增加，但工厂在年底面临投入品价格上涨的问题。【原文：U.S. manufacturing moved closer to recovery in December, with production rebounding and new orders rising further, though factories faced higher prices for inputs as the year ended.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空中客车公司将在 2024 年交付超过 765 架喷气式飞机
item.description: 业内消息人士援引初步数据称，空中客车公司在2024年以微弱劣势未能达到预期交付目标，暂时向航空公司和出租商交付了超过765架喷气式飞机。【原文：Airbus missed its headline delivery target by a whisker in 2024, provisionally releasing more than 765 jets to airlines and lessors, industry sources said, citing preliminary data.】

item.title: 美国外科医生呼吁发出癌症警告后，欧洲饮料集团下滑
item.description: 在美国外科医生呼吁对含酒精饮料发出癌症警告后，欧洲烈酒制造商和酿酒商的股票周五下跌。【原文：Shares in European spirits makers and brewers fell on Friday after the U.S. surgeon general called for cancer warnings on alcoholic drinks.】
